Key Match Events: Corbin Carroll hit a go-ahead grand slam in the eighth inning to sink the Mets in an 8-5 loss to the Diamondbacks
Starling Marte's headfirst dive eluded catcher Adrian Del Castillo's tag to score the go-ahead run in the sixth inning
Harrison Bader's two-run homer tied the game 4-4 in the fifth inning
Post-Match Reflections: Edwin Diaz said 'It was a tough loss today. We had it. We have got to keep playing baseball and at the end of the season we’ll see where we are.'
Diaz also stated 'I have just got to get into the game and get the job done. I didn’t get my job done today.'

Mendoza said 'The past two outings he’s gotten hurt with [the slider], Maybe he’s a little short … but the past two outings to give up a huge hit in that spot. He will make some adjustments and be ready to go.'
Severino said 'There was a little pain out there, but the more I pushed on it, it was a little bit tougher to push it.'
Severino also stated 'Corbin Carroll has been really hot the last couple of months, so he got us tonight.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Luis Severino was removed after 4 ²/₃ innings due to a comebacker off his right foot
Severino underwent X-rays that were negative and plans to make his next start, but will be sore for a few days
Dedniel Nunez was unavailable due to tightness in his right forearm, leaving Phil Maton as the option to begin the eighth
Lourdes Gurriel Jr. walked leading off the inning against Maton to begin the go-ahead rally
Others: Edwin Diaz blew another big game in the Mets’ gut-wrenching loss to Diamondbacks
The Mets fell into a 4-0 hole after four innings before rallying to tie the game in the fifth
The Mets are now four games behind Atlanta in the race for the NL’s third wild card
